decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Painter's Servant and Grindstone. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources and quickly close out the game with powerful dragons like Phyrexian Dragon Engine. The combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive elements, and powerful finishers makes this deck a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and control the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own combo to win the game in a fast and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana by utilizing Cloudpost and other lands to play powerful spells and creatures quickly. The deck includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to create a game-winning board state through a combination of ramp and disruption. With cards like Crop Rotation and The One Ring, the deck can search for key pieces and protect itself from threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful ramp strategy and end the game quickly.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble a combo using cards like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate infinite mana and draw the entire deck. This is achieved by using Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and Gaea's Cradle to produce mana. Once the combo is set up, the player can eventually win the game by casting Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or using Chord of Calling to find a finisher. The deck also includes protection elements like Boseiju, Who Endures and Sylvan Safekeeper to ensure the combo goes off successfully.

The deck focuses on quickly locking down opponents with disruptive cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and The One Ring to limit their options and disrupt their game plan. It also aims to apply pressure by playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and utilizing burn spells like Fury and Shatterskull Smashing. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, while using efficient threats like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers to close out the game before the opponent can recover.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with disruptive spells and removal while utilizing tempo-based creatures to efficiently close out the game. By combining powerful disruption like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will with efficient removal like Fatal Push, along with tempo creatures like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent, this Dimir Tempo deck aims to maintain tempo advantage and pressure the opponent's resources. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, while Nethergoyf and Psychic Frog offer additional threats to round out the strategy. Utilizing a mana-efficient land base with Wasteland for disruption enhances the deck's aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive early-game plays while also incorporating midrange elements to maintain a strong board presence. With a mix of removal spells, counter magic, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on multiple fronts. By utilizing efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and disruptive spells like Daze, the deck can quickly take control of the game and maintain its advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's diverse spell requirements and ensure consistency in its performance.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo card Doomsday to set up a winning sequence of cards in order to secure victory. The deck includes various card draw and manipulation tools such as Brainstorm and Ponder, along with disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual provide mana acceleration to help execute the combo quickly. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition once the combo is assembled, allowing the player to win the game instantly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Throes of Chaos, Creative Technique, and Tibalt's Trickery to quickly ramp up mana and bring out high-cost, powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Apex Devastator. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combo of powerful creatures and spells, utilizing lands like Mossfire Valley and Hickory Woodlot to generate additional resources. The deck aims to quickly build a formidable board presence and win the game before the opponent has a chance to react effectively.
